oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Davidson County Public Building and Court House, Nashville, Tenn., between 1937 and 1956
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front of a color postcard depicting the eight-story high Davidson County Public Building and Court House, completed in 1937 at a cost of $2,000,000. Located on the site of the Old County Court House, it housed the county administrative offices and county courts as well as the city administrative offices. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
